benchmark_details.name: MODEL-PERSONAS
benchmark_details.overview: MODEL-PERSONAS is a large panel of 39 psychological instruments standardized into 693 questions across 115 axes, designed to assess the consistency and robustness of Large Language Models (LLMs)' responses regarding psychological attributes.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the reliability and consistency of Large Language Models' responses to psychological instruments and measures of persona.

data.source: Constructed dataset containing psychological instrument questions for assessing persona attributes.

methodology.calculation: Comprehensibility is the proportion of valid answers generated by the model; sensitivity measures the degree of answer change due to prompt variations; consistency examines the agreement across different paraphrases of the same question.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in generating valid and consistent responses.
methodology.validation: Results validated through testing on multiple Open-Source LLMs.
